Title: Phylogeny and taxonomy of genera Favolus and Neofavolus
Abstract:
Favolus and Neofavolus are two natural genera segregated
from Polyporus. In this article, a taxonomic study based on
morphological characters and phylogenetic analysis of ITS, nLSU, EF1-α,
mtSSU, β-tubulin, RPB1, RPB2 and nSSU sequences was carried out. The
phylogenetic result confirmed that species of Favolus and Neofavolus
evolved in parallel in nature from a common ancestor. Temperature maybe
a determinate factor of distributing of Favolus and Neofavolus spp. Four
new species of Favolus, F. niveus, F. septatus, F. pseudoemeici and F.
subtropicus, are described and illustrated from China.
